text: Pomeranchuk's theorem, named after Soviet physicist Isaak Pomeranchuk, states that difference of cross sections of interactions of elementary particles \kappa_1+\kappa_2 and \kappa_1+\bar{\kappa_2} (i. e. particle {\kappa_1} with particle \kappa_2, and with its antiparticle \bar{\kappa_2}) approach 0 when s \to \infty, where s is the energy in center of mass system. ==See also== * Pomeron == References == * . Category:Physics theorems Category:Quantum field theory
title: Pomeranchuk's theorem
